page.title: 01Plumtree, South Nottingham
page.content: Villages covered-Plumtree, Tollerton and Clipston on the Wolds. These villages are situated approx. 6 miles south of Nottingham. They are mainly dormitory villages although there are many working farms in the area. The majority of the inhabitants work in Nottingham. There is, however, a strong feeling of community identity and security within the villages. The surrounding countryside is green-belt and predominantly used for agriculture. Physically, the land is gently undulating and well drained. The most prominent geographical features are several knolls topped with stands of deciduous trees. The highest point in this block is Hoe Hill (86m above sea level).Both Plumtree and Tollerton were pre_Norman settlements.
